lines.text: So, tell me Corporal, are your intentions honorable?
Aye, sir.
Then you're a damn fool. You leave "honorable intentions" to fathers like me.
We're on a first name basis in this regiment. Your first name is Derek; my first name is Major.

[Getting dressed hurriedly for dance lessons]
Hand me my kilt of burning gold. Where are my plimsolls of desire? It's cruelty, that's what it is, cruelty. Margot Fonteyn couldn't suffer more.
It's not the body worries me - it's the ghost.
Do you really think I made it for my popularity? Do you really think that's why I made this decision?
My dear Colonel, we didn't know that you'd made any decision.
...but... you must have heard that the matter's not to go to Brigade.
Yes, we heard that.
well...
We thought that was Jock's decision. My dear fellow, we didn't even realise you were there.
Whisky for the gentlemen that like it. And for the gentlemen that don't like it - Whisky.
That's a cheesy tune!
[while watching the pipers practice, Barrow notes that some of the men are not wearing the proper caps]
Colonel, there's a tradition here...
I'm all in favor of good tradition.
I've always let the pipers wear pretty well what they please at band practice.
Because you've let them wear what they like just doesn't make it a tradition!
When you're dying, when you really believe you're dying, you think of the most absurd things.
In my war I never had time to think.

Oh they gave me time, all right. Again and again. When I was in the prison camp, they nearly drowned me, then they brought me round. Then they put a wet cloth over my mouth and kept it wet until I nearly drowned again. And the only thing that pulled me through was the thought that one day I'd come back and sit in the middle of that table as colonel of this battalion, like my grandfather and his father before him. Only I was going to be the best of the lot.
...others, Pipe Major.
'Cock of the North,' sir.
Ah, yon's a cheesy tune. You'll no play that.
